Either party may terminate the Agreement due to a material breach by the other party. The non-breaching party must provide written notice and a description of the alleged breach and if the breach can be corrected, the non  breaching party must allow the other party thirty (30) days to cure. The Agreement will terminate at the conclusion of the cure period unless the breaching party has corrected its breach. Termination of the Agreement by the non-breaching party shall be in addition to any other legal or equitable right or remedy available to it. Either party may immediately terminate the Agreement, upon written notice to the other party, in the following circumstances: (i) a party makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors or files a voluntary petition in bankruptcy, or an involuntary petition is filed against a party and is not dismissed within sixty (60) days of its filing date; (ii) a receiver is appointed for a party; (iii) a party admits in writing to its inability to meet its debts as they become due; (iv) a party ceases to conduct business; or (v) a party is adjudged bankrupt or insolvent under the laws of any jurisdiction. 8.3 Termination by Gemalto. Gemalto may terminate the Agreement in the following circumstances: (i) a merger, or acquisition affecting the Licensee with one of Gemalto’s competitors (where “competitor/competitors” means an entity operating in the same or similar industry as Gemalto, which offers, directly or indirectly, equivalent or similar products or services as Gemalto, and within the same territory and/or market); (ii) Licensee breaches any warranty in Sections 6.1 and 6.2; or (iii) in accordance with Sections 2.8.5, 2.8.6, 5.2, 5.6, or the terms of the applicable Service Addendum(s), if any. 8.4 Obligations Upon Termination. Upon the termination of the Agreement all licenses granted hereunder shall cease and Licensee shall: (I) immediately pay all outstanding sums due to Gemalto; (ii) cease, and direct its Licensee Representatives and Distributors to cease, the reproduction, marketing and distribution Licensed Software (except for orders placed prior to the termination date); (iii) return any inventory of Licensed Software to Gemalto and direct its Distributors to return their inventory of the Licensed Software, and Licensee and its Distributors may, at Gemalto’s direction, either return or destroy all copies of the software versions of Licensed Software and provide Gemalto written certification that copies of the software have been destroyed; (iv) terminate its agreements with Distributors; including all rights and sublicenses granted by Licensee related to the Licensed Software under this Agreement; and (v) submit a list of its End Users and Distributors to Gemalto, including names, addresses and contact persons at each location. Unless Gemalto terminates the Agreement for material breach, (where “material breach”, notwithstanding anything to the contrary, shall correspond with the breach of the content of the clauses of this Agreement, including but not limited to, clauses number 2.1,2.2,2.8,4.2.4.3, 4.4, 4.5, 6.2.2 and 7 (to the extent that Licensee is unable to remedy any breach under clauses 4.2 to 4.5 (inclusive) and 7 within a reasonable period of time in accordance with section 8.2. (“reasonable period of time” shall be understood as the period stated in section 8.2.)) termination of the Agreement shall not affect licenses granted to End Users prior to Termination. 9. 9.2.2 fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; or 9.2.3 any other liability which cannot be limited or excluded by applicable law. 9.3 Except with regard to Licensee’s payment obligations, neither Party, its Affiliates, or suppliers, or of the officers, employees or agents of each shall be liable to the other Party, whether in contract, tort (including negligence) or restitution, or for breach of statutory duty or misrepresentation, or otherwise, for any: 9.3.1 loss (whether direct or indirect) of profit, goodwill, business, business opportunity, revenue, turnover, or reputation; 9.3.2 loss (whether direct or indirect) of anticipated saving or wasted expenditure; 9.3.3 loss of or corruption to data or information; or 9.3.4 special, indirect or consequential damage or loss, arising under or in connection with the Agreement. 9.4 Save as explicitly set out in the Agreement, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable law, neither party, its Affiliates and suppliers exclude all liability to the other party its officers, agents, employees, successors and/or assignees for any losses incurred or suffered by any of them or by any other third party resulting from a defect, infringement or alleged infringement, an incident, the failure of the Licensed Software and/or Services (or any part of each thereof) to perform according to the relevant specifications in any applicable Documentation.. 9.5 Subject to clause 9.2 the total aggregate liability of Gemalto (including any liability for the acts or omissions of its employees, Affiliates, agents and sub-contractors) to the Licensee arising under or in connection with the Agreement, whether arising in contract, tort (including negligence) or restitution, or for breach of statutory duty or misrepresentation, or otherwise, shall be limited to 125% of the total price payable under this Agreement 9.6 Under no circumstances shall Gemalto, its Affiliates, or suppliers or of the officers, employees or agents of each be liable to the Licensee for any damages arising out of or in connection with any illegal or fraudulent use of the Licensed Software; Services and/or the Documentation, or any part of them, by the Licensee or any third party. 9.7 Subject to clause 9.2, Licensee’s total aggregate liability under this Agreement including any liability for the acts or omissions of its employees, Affiliates, agents and sub-contractors) to Gemalto arising under or in connection with the Agreement, whether arising in contract, tort (including negligence) or restitution, or for breach of statutory duty or misrepresentation, or otherwise shall not exceed the aggregate amount of the total price paid by Licensee during the twelve month period immediately preceding the date of the breach. 10. Infringement and Indemnification 10.1 Indemnification by Licensee. Licensee agrees to indemnify, defend Gemalto (and its Affiliates, officers, directors, employees and agents) from and against any third party claim arising out of or in connection with any claim arising out of: (i) any claim alleging patent, copyright, trade secret or trademark infringement resulting from or in connection with the use, manufacture, assembly or distribution of the Licensee Application by Licensee, Licensee’s Representatives, or Distributors and its direct and indirect End Users in any country; or (ii) any claim that the Licensee Application, and/or the combination of the Licensee Application and/or Licensed Software with one or more other applications, its content or processes infringes the intellectual property rights of or has otherwise harmed a third party,; (iii) Licensee's or its End Users’ use of Licensee Application, Licensed Software, and/or any Service in violation of the Agreement;(notwithstanding anything to the contrary, this point (iii) of this section shall operate as a common law claim for damages),, provided that Gemalto will: (a) promptly give written notice of the claim to Licensee but in any event within five (5) days after Gemalto first receives notice (provided that any later notice shall relieve Licensee of its liability and obligations under this clause 10.1); (b) give Licensee sole control of the defense and settlement of the claim (provided that Licensee may not settle or defend any Sentinel License Terms and Conditions - Confidential Copyright © 2018 Gemalto 10 claim unless it unconditionally releases Gemalto of all liability); and (c) provide all reasonable assistance and cooperation with Licensee during any defense or settlement efforts; and (d) not make not any admission, concession, consent judgment, default judgment or settlement of the applicable infringement claim or any part thereof (unless otherwise agreed by Licensee in writing). Gemalto may, at its own expense, monitor any such litigation or proceeding using counsel of its choosing. 10.2 Indemnification by Gemalto. Gemalto will defend, at its expense, and indemnify Licensee, from and against any losses, costs or damages arising from any claims filed by third parties against Licensee alleging that the Licensed Software and/or Service, as provided to Licensee, infringes any previously patent, trade secret, copyright or trademark, provided that Licensee promptly notifies Gemalto, in writing, of such claim and Gemalto is given full and complete authority (including settlement authority),information and assistance by Licensee for such defense. Licensee agrees to promptly notify Gemalto of any unauthorized or potentially infringing use of the Licensed Software and/or Service and will provide all reasonable assistance, cooperation and information as may be reasonably requested by Gemalto. In the event the Licensed Software and/or Service is found to infringe a third party right and its use is enjoined, or, if, in the opinion of Gemalto, the Licensed Software and/or Service is likely to become the subject of such a claim, Gemalto, at its election and expense, will either: (i) procure for Licensee the right to continue using the Licensed Software and/or Service; or (ii) modify or replace the Licensed Software and/or Service so that it becomes non-infringing while providing substantially equivalent performance. In the event that neither of the foregoing options are available using reasonable commercial efforts, in Gemalto's sole opinion, then Gemalto may terminate the Agreement and any affected service offerings, and with respect to Licensed Software, refund amounts Licensee paid Gemalto for the Licensed Software which is subject of such claim, less its depreciated value (applying the straight line depreciation method and assuming an estimated useful life of five years); with respect to Services, refund amounts paid by Licensee for Services not yet rendered. The indemnification obligation shall not apply to infringement actions or claims to the extent that such actions or claims are based on or result from: (a) modifications to the Licensed Software and/or Service by a party other than Gemalto (unless Gemalto expressly consents to such modifications); (b) Licensee’s failure to use the most recent version (or such other version made available in the previous 24 month period) of the Licensed Software, or to otherwise take any corrective action directed by Gemalto; or (c) the use, sale, manufacture, assembly or distribution of the Licensee Application, unless such actions or claims are based solely on use of the Licensed Software in the form provided by Gemalto. 11. Any Licensed Software delivered in the form of computer software and technical data and acquired by Licensee, Distributor or End User on behalf of the United States Government or any contractor thereof, shall be classified as “commercial computer software developed at private expense” and delivered subject to “RESTRICTED RIGHTS” as defined in 48 CFR 12.212, 2.101, DFAR 227.7202-1 through 4 Federal Acquisition Regulation (“FAR") 52.227-19(c)(2) and the Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation (“DFAR”) 252.227-7013 to 7019, as applicable. Use, duplication or disclosure of the Licensed Software and Documentation by the U.S. Government and parties acting on its behalf is governed by and subject to the restrictions set forth in FAR 52.227-19(c)(1) and (2) or DFAR 252.227-7013 to 7019, as applicable. Gemalto provides the Services, including related software and technology, for ultimate federal government end use solely in accordance with the following: Government technical data and software rights related to the Service include only those rights customarily provided to the public as defined in the Agreement or any applicable Service Addendum. This customary commercial license is provided in accordance with FAR 12.211 (Technical Data) and FAR 12.212 (Software) and, for Department of Defense transactions, DFAR 252.227-7015 (Technical Data - Commercial Items) and DFAR 227.7202-03 (Rights In Commercial Computer Software or Computer Software Documentation). If a government agency has a need for rights not conveyed under these terms, it must negotiate with Gemalto to determine if there are acceptable terms for transferring such rights, and a mutually acceptable written Service Addendum specifically conveying such rights must be included in any applicable contract or agreement. Sentinel License Terms and Conditions - Confidential Copyright © 2018 Gemalto 11 11.3 Injunctive Relief. All rights, remedies and powers of a party hereunder are irrevocable and cumulative, and not alternative or exclusive, and shall be in addition to all other rights, remedies and powers to which it may be entitled by law. Each party acknowledges that if it breaches any obligations hereunder, the other party may suffer immediate and irreparable harm for which monetary damages alone shall not be a sufficient remedy, and in addition to all other remedies, such other party shall be entitled to seek injunctive relief, specific performance, equitable relief or any other remedy necessary to prevent a threatened breach by the other party or to correct an actual breach and to enforce the Agreement. Each party hereby waives any and all defenses and objections it may have on grounds of jurisdiction and venue, including, but not limited to, lack of personal jurisdiction and improper venue, and waives any requirement for the securing or posting of any bond in connection with such remedy. 11.4 Publicity. No public release or statement concerning the subject matter of this Agreement shall be made by either party without the express written consent and approval of the other party, except as required by law or stock exchange rule. 11.5 Counterparts. The Agreement may be executed by facsimile, counterparts or duplicate originals, all of which shall be regarded as one and the same instrument. 11.6 Survival. Survival. Those provisions that by their nature are intended to survive termination or expiration of the Agreement shall so survive (such as (but not limited to) the Sections 3, 7, 9,10,11). 11.7 No Third-Party Beneficiaries. There are no third-party beneficiaries to the Agreement. 11.8 Notice. All notices and other communications required or permitted hereunder must be in writing and will be deemed to have been duly given: when delivered by hand or confirmed facsimile transmission; one (1) day after delivery by receipted overnight delivery; or three (3) days after being mailed by certified or registered mail, return receipt requested, with postage prepaid to the party at the address set forth in the Sentinel Agreement, or to such address and/or facsimile number as either party shall furnish to the other party in writing pursuant to this Section. 11.9 Assiqnment/Subcontractors. Licensee may not assign, delegate or transfer the Agreement, in whole or in part, or any of its rights or duties hereunder, including by merger (regardless of whether Licensee is the surviving entity) or acquisition, without the prior written consent of Gemalto provided such consent shall not be required for Licensee to assign, delegate or transfer this Agreement to an Affiliate. Any attempted assignment in violation of the Agreement is void. Notwithstanding anything the contrary herein, Gemalto may assign or transfer the Agreement, in whole or in part, to any third party without the prior written consent of Licensee. Subject to the foregoing, the Agreement shall be binding upon, and shall inure to the benefit of, the parties and their respective successors or permitted assigns. Gemalto may contract with third parties and suppliers to provide certain portions of the Services and/or support services thereto, and references to Gemalto necessarily include any such third parties and suppliers. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Gemalto remains solely responsible for all services provided hereunder and for all acts and omissions as though Gemalto acted itself. 11.10 Waiver. No waiver of any of the provisions of the Agreement shall constitute a waiver of any other provision of the Agreement, nor shall such waiver constitute a continuing waiver. The failure of either party to enforce at any time any of the provisions of the Agreement, or the failure of either party to require the performance by the other party of any provisions of the Agreement, shall not be construed as a waiver of such provisions in the future, nor will it affect the ability of a party to enforce each and every provision thereafter. 11.11 Severability. If any court of competent jurisdiction holds any provision of the Agreement invalid or unenforceable, the other provisions of the Agreements will remain in full force and effect. Any provision of the Agreement held invalid or unenforceable only in part will remain in full force and effect to the extent it is not held invalid or unenforceable. The invalid or unenforceable provision shall be changed and interpreted so as to best accomplish its intent within the limits of the applicable law or court decisions. 11.12 Force Majeure. Neither party shall be in breach of the Agreement for any failure or delay in the performance of its obligations, hereunder (except for the payment of money) as a result of a Force Majeure, such as fire, explosion, acts of God, sabotage, labour conditions, war, insurrection, terrorism, government regulation or act or any other cause beyond the reasonable control of such party, provided that the affected party gives the other party prompt written notice of the delay and uses its best efforts to cure it. 11.13 Audit Rights. Licensee shall maintain accurate and complete books relating to revenues associated with the Licensee Application and shall retain this information for twelve (12) months following the termination of the Agreement. Copies of such books and shall be maintained at Licensee’s principal place of business. Gemalto, or an independent certified public accountant acting on its behalf, may, upon reasonable notice to Licensee and at a mutually convenient time, conduct an annual audit of such books for the sole purpose of confirming the accuracy of reported Annual Revenue. The right for Gemalto to carry out any such audit under this clause 11.13 shall be subject to the following conditions: (i) Gemalto or any third party acting on its behalf shall have supervised access to Licensee’s books and under no circumstances shall copies be taken or be removed from Licensee’s premises, (ii) Gemalto, its employees or other third party on its behalf who is engaged to carry out the audit shall, prior to auditing Licensee's books, each enter into a confidentiality agreement, (iii) comply with Licensee’s reasonable security requirements and (iv) any audit shall be performed in such a manner so as to not disrupt Licensee's business and operations. In the event that an audit reveals that Annual Revenue have been underreported, then Licensee shall immediately pay to Gemalto upon written request any additional fee due plus interest from the date that the payment was first due until the date on which full payment is made, at a per annum rate of four percent (4). All inspections or audits of Licensee's books and records shall be conducted at Gemalto's expense, unless the inspection discloses an underpayment of fees by Licensee of five percent (5%) or more, in which case, Licensee shall bear the cost of any additional investigation by Gemalto in respect of the underpayment of the fees. SAGENT TECHNOLOGY, INC. SAGEMT DATABASE LICENSE AGREEMENT END USER This AGREEMENT is made and entered into as of 01/18/02 (the "Effective Date") by and between Sagent Technology, Inc. ("Sagent") located at 800 W. El Camino Real, Suite 300, Mountain View, California 94040, USA, and ALLTEL Corporation located at 4001 Rodney Parham Road, Little Rock, Arkansas 72212 including its subsidiaries and affiliates (the "Licensee"). 1. License In accordance with the terms herein and subject to all restrictions in Exhibit A, Sagent grants to Licensee, and Licensee accepts from Sagent, a non-exclusive, and non-transferable license to use the Databases set forth on Exhibit A and any updates of the Databases as may be provided by Sagent. Licensee may use the Databases in conjunction with the Software (as defined in the Software License Agreement between the parties of even date herewith) for processing data of third parties with whom Licensee has a data processing agreement, provided that such third parties may not themselves access the Software. Licensee’s use is restricted so that Licensee may not: (a) Sublicense, sell, lease, rent, use the Databases, or permit any third party to use the Databases, except as expressly set forth in this Section 1 above, for consulting services, time sharing, service bureaus, outsourcing services, application service provider services, or application hosting provider services; (b) Decompile, disassemble, separate, or reverse engineer the Databases; (c) Reveal benchmark tests; (d) Use the Databases in violation of any Federal or State law, regulation or rules, including laws with respect to misuse or improper use of information. (e) Use the Databases in violation of any of the terms staled on Exhibit A. Licensee shall indemnify, defend, and hold Sagent harmless from any claim based Licensee’s use of the Databases in violation of these restrictions, provided that Licensee is immediately notified in writing of such claim. Licensee shall have the right to control the defense of all such claims, lawsuits and other proceedings. In no event shall Sagent settle any such claim, lawsuit or proceeding without prior notice to Licensee. 2. Copies The license(s) granted herein include(s) the right to copy and use the Databases as specified in Exhibit A pursuant to this license and for archival and back-up only. In order to protect Sagent's copyrights in the Databases, Licensee agrees to reproduce and incorporate Sagent's copyright notice in any copy, modifications or partial copy. 3. Term The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall run for a period of one (1) year from the Effective Date (the “Initial Term”), and shall automatically renew for consecutive one (1) year periods (each such year, a “Renewal Tenn”) unless either party provides written notice of termination to the other party within sixty (60) days prior to the anniversary date of the Effective Date or the expiration of any Renewal Term, as the case may be. If no such notice is received within said time frame, Licensee shall be deemed to have renewed this Agreement and shall pay for all fees and charges in connection therewith as provided in this Agreement. REV8/01/2000 Sagent Technology, Inc. Database License Agreement End User Page 1 4. Price and Payment (a) Licensee will be billed upon signing this Agreement a fee of U.S. $4,000.00 (plus applicable sales tax, if any), as more particularly described on Exhibit A, payable net 30. (b) The annual fee for each Renewal Term of this Agreement will be U.S. $4,000.00 (plus applicable sales tax, if any) and will be invoiced automatically 90 days prior to the expiration of the Initial Term or any Renewal Term, as the case may be, unless this Agreement is earlier terminated pursuant to the provisions set forth herein. The annual fee for each Renewal Term of this Agreement will be due on the first day of such Renewal Term. Interest on past due accounts shall accrue at the rate of 1.5% per month or the highest amount permitted by law, whichever is lower. Sagent may upon 15 days advance written notice suspend delivery of the Databases until past due payments are made. 5. Databases Ownership Sagent represents that it has all rights required to licensee the Databases and all portions thereof and to grant Licensee the license. 6. Updates During the Initial Term and each Renewal Tenn of this Agreement, Licensor agrees to provide Licensee with copies of all Database updates as they are released and made generally available by Licensor to its customers. 7. Title to Databases The Databases and all copies thereof are proprietary to or licensed to Sagent and title and sublicense rights thereto remain with Sagent. All applicable rights to patents, copyrights, trademarks and trade secrets in the Databases or any modifications or derivative works based on the Databases belong to and shall remain in Sagent. Licensee retains ownership of its own software and databases even if embedded or integrated with the Databases. Licensee shall not sell, transfer, publish, or otherwise make available the Databases or copies thereof to others. Licensee agrees to secure and protect each module, Databases, documentation and copies thereof in a manner consistent with the maintenance of Sagent's rights therein and to take appropriate action by instruction or agreement with its employees or consultants who are permitted access to the Databases to satisfy its obligations hereunder. All copies made by the Licensee of the Databases and other programs developed hereunder, including translations, compilations, partial copies with modifications and updated works, are the property of Sagent. Violation of any provision of this paragraph shall be the basis for immediate termination of this Agreement. 8. Confidentiality Each party agrees to protect the other party’s Proprietary Information (as defined below) the same degree of protection against unauthorized use or disclosure as each party normally provides for its Proprietary Information, provided that each party’s obligation shall not apply to information which: i) is known to the receiving party at the time of disclosure by the disclosing party, ii) is now or hereafter in the public domain through no fault of the receiving party; iii) is developed independently by the receiving party, and iv) is generally known or available from third parties without restriction. The term “Proprietary Information” means documented information, software or databases that at the time of its disclosure to the receiving party is identified as Proprietary or Confidential by an appropriate stamp or legend. This Agreement is Confidential. REV8/01/2000 Sagent Technology, Inc. Database License Agreement End User Page 2 9. Warranty (a) Sagent warrants that the Databases will conform, as to all substantial operational features, to Sagent's current published specifications when installed and will be free of defects which substantially affect system performance. (b) Licensee must notify Sagent in writing, within ninety (90) days of delivery of the Databases to Licensee (not including delivery of any subsequent modifications to the Databases), of its claim of any such defect. If the Databases is found defective by Sagent, Sagent's sole obligation under this warranty is to use reasonable commercial efforts to attempt to correct or work around errors, replace defective media provided by Sagent or replace the Databases with functionally equivalent Databases. (c) Sagent warrants that the Databases does not cause erroneous date calculations due to miscalculations by the Databases as a result of the year 2000 date change. Sagent further warrants that the Databases includes the ability to manage and manipulate all data involving dates or date fields which include indication of century to ensure year 2000 compatibility. (d) THE ABOVE IS A LIMITED WARRANTY AND IT IS THE ONLY WARRANTY MADE BY SAGENT. SAGENT MAKES AND LICENSEE RECEIVES NO WARRANTY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AND THERE ARE EXPRESSLY EXCLUDED ALL WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. SAGENT SHALL HAVE NO LIABILITY WITH RESPECT TO ITS OBLIGATIONS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, EXEMPLARY, OR INCIDENTAL DAMAGES EVEN IF IT HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. THE STATED EXPRESS WARRANTY IS IN LIEU OF ALL LIABILITIES OR OBLIGATIONS OF SAGENT FOR DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE DELIVERY, USE OR ACCURACY OF THE DATABASES. (e) If any modifications are made to the Databases by Licensee during the warranty period, this warranty shall immediately be terminated. Correction for difficulties or defects traceable to Licensee's errors or system changes shall be billed at Sagent's standard time and material charges. (i) Licensee agrees that Sagent's liability arising out of contract, negligence, strict liability in tort, or warranty shall not exceed any amounts paid by Licensee for the Databases identified on Exhibit A. 10. Indemnity Sagent will indemnify, defend, and hold Licensee harmless against a any claim that the Databases used within the scope of this Agreement infringes any U.S. or E.C. patent, copyright, license or other property right, provided that Sagent is immediately notified in writing of such claim. Sagent shall have the right to control the defense of all such claims, lawsuits and other proceedings. In no event shall Licensee settle any such claim, lawsuit or proceeding without Sagent's prior written approval. If as a result of any claim of infringement against any patent, copyright, license or other property right, Sagent or Licensee is enjoined from using the Databases, or if Sagent believes that the Databases is likely to become the subject of a claim of infringement, Sagent at its option and expense may procure the right for Licensee to continue to use the Databases, or replace or modify the Databases so as to make it non-infringing. If neither of these two options is reasonably practicable Sagent may discontinue the license granted herein on one month's written notice and refund to Licensee the portion of the Initial License Fee or Renewal License Fee, as the case may be, paid by Licensee which is attributable to the remaining portion of the Initial Term or the Renewal Term, as the case may be. The foregoing states the entire liability of Sagent with respect to infringement of any copyrights or patents by the Databases or any parts thereof. 11. Marketing In consideration of the rights granted in this license, Sagent has the right to disclose to the public that Licensee has entered into this Agreement and is licensee of Sagent. Licensee agrees that Sagent shall be permitted to disclose to the public Licensee's use of the Databases including hardware configurations, benchmarks, results, name and logo mark for marketing purposes including, but not limited to collateral materials, advertising, direct marketing and the web. REV8/01/2000 Sagent Technology, Inc. Database License Agreement End User Page 3 12. Termination (a) Sagent shall have the right to terminate this Agreement and license(s) granted herein upon ten days' written notice in the event that Licensee, its officers or employees breach any material provision of this Agreement including, but not limited to, confidentiality or payment, and Licensee fails to cure such breach within 10 days after receipt of written notice. (b) Within five (5) days after termination of the license(s), Licensee will return to Sagent the Databases in the form provided by Sagent or as modified by the Licensee, or upon request by Sagent to destroy the Databases and all copies, and certify in writing that they have been destroyed. Termination under this paragraph shall not relieve either party of its obligations regarding confidentiality of the other party's Proprietary Information. (c) Without limiting any of the above provisions, in the event of termination as a result of the Licensee's failure to comply with any of its obligations under this Agreement, Licensee shall continue to be obligated for any payments due. Termination of the license shall be in addition to and not in lieu of any equitable remedies available to Sagent (d) Licensee may terminate this Agreement at any time provided payment in full has been made and Licensee returns the original and all copies of Databases to Sagent. 13. Taxes Except for taxes based on Sagent’s income, Licensee shall, in addition to the other amounts payable under this Agreement pay all sales and other taxes, federal, state, or otherwise, however designated, which are levied or imposed by reason of the transactions contemplated by this Agreement. Without limiting the foregoing, Licensee shall promptly pay to Sagent an amount equal to any such items actually paid, or required to be collected or paid by Sagent. 14. General (a) Each party acknowledges that it has read this Agreement, it understands it, and agrees to be bound by its terms, and further agrees that this is the complete and exclusive statement of the Agreement between the parties, which supersedes and merges all prior proposals, understandings and all other agreements, oral and written, between the parties relating to this Agreement. data.text: DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F END USER LICENSE AGREEMENT (“EULA”) For RiskSense® This Software Hosting Agreement con-08310 (the "Agreement") is entered into and effective as of August 1, 2016 (the "Effective Date") between RiskSense ("HOST") and Vanitv, LLC ("CUSTOMER"). 1. DEFINITIONS 1.1. “Affiliate Companies” means any entity that directly or indirectly owns or controls, is owned or controlled by, or is under common ownership or control with, CUSTOMER. 1.2 "CUSTOMER Data" means all information entered into the Hosting System by CUSTOMER in the course of its authorized use of the Hosting System and stored on the HOST Server for access by the Hosting System and retrieval by CUSTOMER. “Customer Data” shall also mean all information entered into the Hosting System as a result of security assessment services performed by the HOST for the CUSTOMER. Such security assessment services shall be contracted for under a separate professional services agreement. 1.3. Customer Secure Data” is a subset of Customer Data, including: (i) (“Confidential”) is data such as but not limited to confidential Customer’s customer information, that is not designated as Restricted, or tied to a person’s identity, contract terms, department budgets, marketing and sales plans, pre-public release product information, or (ii) (“Restricted”) is data such as but not limited to access credentials such as passwords, passphrases, and challenge question responses, financial account or payment card numbers, customer information that is tied to a person’s identity legal proceedings, unless publicly available, projected earnings/loss statements, protected health information (“PHI”), social security or tax ID numbers, or gift, debit, or credit card numbers. 1.4 "HOST Server" means the computer server or servers provided by HOST through which CUSTOMER accesses the Hosting System, identified by a URL and one or more accounts and passwords to be established by CUSTOMER. 1.5. "Hosting System" means the computer software in object code form owned or provided by HOST, through the HOST Server, for which CUSTOMER has License Rights granted pursuant to this Agreement, updates and upgrades to the Hosting System, and online documentation. 1.6. "Intellectual Property Rights" means inventions, patent applications, patents, design rights, utility models, copyrights, trademarks, service marks, trade names, domain name rights, mask work rights, know-how and other trade secret rights, and all other intellectual property rights, derivatives thereof, and forms of protection of a similar nature anywhere in the world. 1.7. "Services" means (i) the Hosting System services consisting of exclusive electronic access to the HOST Server to store CUSTOMER Data and make HOST Server available on demand by Con-08310 sarf_229438 1 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F CUSTOMER via the Internet as more specifically identified in section 3.1 hereof (“Hosting Services”), (ii) those Data Security services identified in Section 3.3 hereof, (iii) the preparation of Reports as described in Section 3.4 hereof and (iv) such other additional services as are identified on Exhibit 1hereto. 2. USE OF HOSTING SYSTEM 2.1 License Subscription Rights Granted A. HOST hereby grants CUSTOMER, and Affiliated Companies, a non-exclusive, non- transferable, worldwide right to access and use the Hosting System (the “License Rights”), subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement for the creation, management and tracking of CUSTOMER Data for internal use and for use by third party customers. CUSTOMER shall have no right to (i) act as a reseller or distributor of the Hosting System or Services, or as a service bureau for the Hosting System or Services; (ii) use the Hosting System to create, manage or track any third party content on behalf of third parties, except as expressly authorized herein; or (iii) use the Hosting System in any other way that is in competition with HOST. All rights not expressly granted to CUSTOMER are reserved by HOST. B. Intentionally removed. C. CUSTOMER agrees not to cause or permit the reverse engineering, disassembly or decompilation of the Hosting System. 2.2. Verification; Audits. Subject to the limitations contained in Section 9.1, HOST shall have the right to audit use of the Hosting System by CUSTOMER electronically at any time. 3. SERVICES 3.1. Hosting Services. HOST will provide CUSTOMER with access to the online Hosting System and will provide for the storage and retrieval of CUSTOMER Data on demand in connection with use of the Hosting System. CUSTOMER is responsible for obtaining access to the Internet using software and hardware that meet CUSTOMER’s minimum requirements, including security requirements. 3.2. Access. CUSTOMER users may include CUSTOMER employees and customers and contractors. CUSTOMER is responsible for the confidentiality and use of account names and passwords. HOST will deem any communication, data transfer, or use of the Hosting System received under CUSTOMER account names and passwords to be for CUSTOMER’s benefit and use. CUSTOMER agrees to notify HOST if account names or passwords are lost, stolen, or being used in an unauthorized manner. CUSTOMER represents and warrants that it has the rights to all CUSTOMER Data, including the right to upload CUSTOMER Data to the HOST Server in connection with its authorized use of the Hosting System. CUSTOMER agrees that the CUSTOMER Data and its use do not infringe the rights of any third party and agrees to indemnify and hold HOST harmless from any third-party claims of infringement as provided herein. Con-08310 sarf_229438 2 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F 3.3. Data Security. CUSTOMER agrees to access the Hosting System and to store and retrieve data using third party programs, including specifically Internet "browser" programs that support data security protocols compatible with those specified by HOST in the online documentation. HOST agrees to back-up and maintain the security of CUSTOMER Data using industry-standard back-up tools and data security protocols, and other methods reasonably deemed to be adequate for secure business data and to notify CUSTOMER immediately in the event of a breach of security involving CUSTOMER Data. 3.4 Reports. HOST shall prepare and provide CUSTOMER access to reports assessing vulnerabilities in the CUSTOMER’S network as may be requested by CUSTOMER (the “Reports”). 4. TERMINATION 4.1 Termination. Either party may terminate the Agreement or any order, statement of work, or similar document, if the other party commits a material breach that remains uncured after thirty (30) days written notice specifying the nature of the breach and identifying the measures required to correct the breach. 4.2. Effect of Termination. Termination of the license shall not preclude HOST from pursuing other remedies available to it, including injunctive relief. Upon termination of this Agreement, HOST shall allow CUSTOMER limited access to the Hosting System for thirty (30) days to allow CUSTOMER to retrieve any CUSTOMER Data stored on the HOST Server, following which access to the Hosting System and all Services shall be terminated. Limited access during this period shall allow CUSTOMER only to (i) view and retrieve CUSTOMER Data; and (ii) complete pending transactions; but shall not include Support Services for the Hosting System or access to their functionality. Upon termination, other than for breach on the part of HOST under Section 4.1 above, all undisputed unpaid fees related to the Initial Term or any Renewal Term shall be due and payable in full immediately. Upon termination, HOST shall refund to CUSTOMER any and all fees paid in advance as such fees relate to any unused periods (based on a monthly pro-rata basis). If there is any dispute regarding the fees that are owed, such dispute shall be addressed in the manner stated in Section 9.3 of this Agreement. 4.3 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue thereafter for 3 years (“Initial Term”) and unless either party provides notice 90 days prior to the then current term, it shall renew for periods of 1 year (each, a “Renewal Term”), collectively the (“Term”) unless earlier terminated in accordance with this Agreement. 5. SUPPORT SERVICES Support services for this licensing agreement will be as per the Service level Agreement in Exhibit 1 to this Agreement, CUSTOMER SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENT (“SLA”) Con-08310 sarf_229438 3 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F 6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY OWNERSHIP 6.1 Hosting System. HOST retains all title, copyright, Intellectual Property Rights and other proprietary rights in the Hosting System. CUSTOMER does not acquire any rights, express or implied, in the Hosting System, other than those specified in the Agreement. CUSTOMER agrees that it will not use the Hosting System for sharing inappropriate materials, including without limitation materials containing viruses or other harmful code; unsolicited mail (spam); copyrighted materials to which CUSTOMER does not have appropriate rights; pornography or other adult materials offensive to community standards; harassing, tortious, or defamatory materials; or other materials prohibited by applicable international, federal, state, or local laws and regulations. CUSTOMER and HOST agree to fully comply with all federal, state, and local privacy laws in connection with use of the Hosting System and Services. 6.2 HOST Technology; Services. HOST (and its licensors, where applicable) shall own all right, title and interest, including all related Intellectual Property Rights, in and to the HOST technology, the content, excluding CUSTOMER Data and the Services (including any Reports issued as part of the Services). In the event CUSTOMER provides any suggestions, ideas, enhancement requests, or feedback (“Feedback”) to HOST with respect to the Services, CUSTOMER agrees that HOST may freely use, disclose, reproduce, license, distribute and otherwise commercialize the Feedback in any HOST product or service. This Agreement is not a sale and does not convey any rights of ownership in or related to the Services (including the Reports, excluding Customer Data), the HOST technology or the Intellectual Property Rights owned by HOST. The HOST name, the HOST logo, and the product names associated with the Services are trademarks of HOST or third parties, and no right or license is granted to use them. 6.3. Ownership of Customer Data and License. 6.3.1 Ownership of CUSTOMER Data. CUSTOMER shall retain ownership of all CUSTOMER Data stored or retrieved in connection with use of the Hosting System and Hosting Services, which data shall be subject to the confidentiality provisions set forth in Section 9.1 hereof. CUSTOMER agrees that back-up or archival of CUSTOMER Data is not an infringement of any intellectual property rights of CUSTOMER or any third party, subject to the confidentiality provisions set forth in Section 9.1. CUSTOMER agrees that it will not store data on the HOST Server that is subject to the rights of any third parties without first obtaining all required authorizations and rights in writing from such third parties. 6.3.2 Permitted Use of CUSTOMER Data; Ownership of Aggregate Data. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, CUSTOMER hereby grants to HOST a non-exclusive, world-wide and irrevocable license permitting HOST to copy, anonymize, aggregate, process and display CUSTOMER Data to derive anonymous statistical and usage data, and data about the functionality of the Services, provided such data cannot be used to identify CUSTOMER or its individual users ("Anonymous Data"), for the purposes of combining or incorporating such Anonymous Data with or into other similar data and information available, derived or obtained from other clients, licensees, users, or otherwise (when so combined or incorporated, referred to as "Aggregate Data"), so as to Con-08310 sarf_229438 4 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F permit HOST to provide information relating to the Aggregate Data and related or similar other statistics or data to third parties. HOST will be the owner of all right, title and interest in and to Aggregate Data. This provision shall survive the termination of this Agreement. HOST shall not sell Anonymous Data. HOST shall only share Aggregate Data with third parties when there exists at least ten (10) sources of data from clients or clients of licensees comprising Aggregate Data. 6.3.3. Customer Name; Marketing and Branding. The CUSTOMER’S name, CUSTOMER’S logo, and the product names associated with the CUSTOMER data are owned by CUSTOMER, including, without limitation, any copyrights and/or trademarks associated therewith, and may not be used or reproduced by HOST without prior written approval by CUSTOMER, in its sole discretion. 7. INDEMNITY, WARRANTIES, REMEDIES 7.1 Disclaimer of Warranties. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, HOST DOES NOT MAKE ANY REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY, OR GUARANTY AS TO THE RELIABILITY, TIMELINESS, QUALITY, SUITABILITY, TRUTH, AVAILABILITY, ACCURACY OR COMPLETENESS OF THE SERVICES OR ANY CONTENT OR INFORMATION. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT, HOST DOES NOT REPRESENT OR WARRANT THAT (A) THE USE OF THE SERVICES WILL BE, UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE OR OPERATE IN COMBINATION WITH ANY OTHER HARDWARE, SOFTWARE, SYSTEM OR DATA, (B) THE SERVICES WILL MEET CUSTOMER’S REQUIREMENTS OR EXPECTATIONS, (C) THE QUALITY OF ANY PRODUCTS, SERVICES, INFORMATION, OR OTHER MATERIAL PURCHASED OR OBTAINED BY CUSTOMER THROUGH THE SERVICES WILL MEET CUSTOMER’S REQUIREMENTS OR EXPECTATIONS, OR (D) ERRORS OR DEFECTS WILL BE CORRECTED. THE SERVICES AND ALL CONTENT AND INFORMATION IS PROVIDED STRICTLY ON AN "AS IS" BASIS. ALL CONDITIONS, REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, OR NONINFRINGEMENT OF THIRD-PARTY RIGHTS, ARE HEREBY DISCLAIMED TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW. 7.2. Internet Delays. THE SERVICES MAY BE SUBJECT TO LIMITATIONS, DELAYS, AND OTHER PROBLEMS INHERENT IN THE USE OF THE INTERNET AND ELECTRONIC COMMUNICATIONS. HOST IS NOT RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY DELAYS, DELIVERY FAILURES, OR OTHER DAMAGE RESULTING FROM SUCH PROBLEMS. 7.3 Representations and Warranties. HOST represents and warrants that: (a) Hosting System and Services will perform in conformity with its documentation, manuals, and specifications, (b) to its knowledge, there are no suits or proceedings pending or threatened which allege any infringement of any third party intellectual property rights, and (c) it has the valid right to grant to CUSTOMER all rights to the Hosting System and Services as granted herein. HOST will use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure that the Hosting System and Services will be available to CUSTOMER 24 hours a day, 7 days a week during the term of this Agreement, normal maintenance and unforeseen hardware or communications problems excepted. HOST will make every effort to Con-08310 sarf_229438 5 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY OIK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F schedule routine maintenance during HOST’s non-business hours. HOST represents and warrants that all CUSTOMER DATA will be stored within the United States. 7.4. Limitation of Liability. 7.4.1 Except as provided in paragraph 7.4.2 of this Section 7.4: 7.4.1.1 Neither party will be liable to the other party for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages (including lost profits, revenues or other financial losses) arising under or relating in any way to this Agreement, regardless of the theory under which such damages are claimed (including tort, breach of contract, etc.), and even if a party has been advised of or is otherwise aware of the possibility of such damages; and 7.4.1.2 Each party’s total liability for damages, claims, liabilities, costs, expenses, or losses to the other party arising under or relating in any way to this Agreement, regardless of the theory under which such damages are claimed (including tort, breach of contract, etc.), will not exceed the greater of $2 million dollars ($2,000,000) or two (2) times the total amount of fees paid or payable by CUSTOMER under this Agreement. 7.4.2 The limitations set forth in paragraph 7.4.1 of this Section 7.4 will not apply to damages, claims, liabilities, costs, expenses, or losses that are: 7.4.2.1 Incurred or required to be paid by either party (the indemnifying party) to the other party pursuant to the indemnification provision of this Agreement in Section 7.5; or 7.4.2.2 Incurred by either party as a result of a breach by the other party of Section 9.1 (Confidential Information); 7.4.2.2.1 Incurred by CUSTOMER due to HOSTS’s fraud or intentional misconduct; or 7.4.2.3 Incurred by CUSTOMER due to HOST’s gross negligence or willful conduct hereunder; 7.5. Indemnity. 7.5.1 Subject to limitations set forth in Sections 7.1, 7.2, and 7.3, HOST shall indemnify CUSTOMER (and its officers, directors and partners) from and against any and all liability, damage, loss or expense, arising from any claim, demand, action or proceeding based upon or arising out of (i) any claim of violations of infringe or breach any copyright, design, trade name, trademark, service mark, patent or other proprietary or equitable right of any person or entity; (ii) the breach or alleged breach of any of the obligations, representations or warranties set forth in this Agreement; or (iii)incurred in the settlement or avoidance of any such claim, provided, however, that CUSTOMER shall give prompt legal notice to HOST of the assertion of any such claim. HOST shall not agree to any settlement that admits liability on the part of CUSTOMER or imposes any liability or obligation on CUSTOMER for which HOST will not be responsible under this Section 7.5, unless otherwise mutually agreed to in writing by the parties. This agreement to indemnify shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement. Con-08310 sarf_229438 6 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F 7.5.2 CUSTOMER shall indemnify and defend HOST against all costs, and losses arising out of any action by a third party against HOST arising directly or indirectly out of or incidental to (i) the breach by CUSTOMER of any of its obligations or covenants hereunder; or (ii) an alleged infringement by CUSTOMER Data of a third party’s intellectual property right(s), provided, however, that HOST shall give prompt legal notice to CUSTOMER of the assertion of any such claim and provided further that HOST shall have the right to participate in the defense thereof at its own expense. This agreement to indemnify shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement. 7.6. Exclusive Remedies. For any breach of the warranties contained in Section 7.3, CUSTOMER’S exclusive remedy, and HOST's entire liability, shall be: 7.6.1. For Hosting System and Hosting Services: The correction of Hosting Program errors that caused breach of the warranty at no charge to CUSTOMER. Any error not reported to HOST by CUSTOMER within sixty (60) days of its discovery by CUSTOMER will be deemed waived and accepted by CUSTOMER. 7.6.2 For all other Services: The re-performance of the Services at no additional charge to CUSTOMER, provided that CUSTOMER notifies HOST in writing of any defects in the Services within ninety (90) days of their performance. 7.7 Compliance and Laws. Each party hereto agrees that it shall comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws, ordinances, codes and regulations in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement (“Laws”). If HOST Services include or HOST otherwise has access to CUSTOMER Secure Data then, HOST agrees to comply with the ISO 27001 Security Standard (“ISO 27001”). HOST represents and warrants that the systems, software and all applicable products and services of HOST used under the Agreement are, and shall at all times during the Term of the Agreement, remain fully compliant with ISO 27001, or an equivalent standard acceptable to CUSTOMER, including, but not limited to, the 14 prime sections of ISO 27001 as follows: (1) Information Security Policies; (2) Organization of Information Security; (3) Human Resource Security; (4) Asset Management; (5) Access Control; (6) Cryptography; (7) Physical and Environmental Security; (8) Operations Security; (9) Communications Security; (10) System Acquisition Development and Maintenance; (11) Supplier Relationships; (12) Information Security Incident Management; (13) Information Security Aspects of Business Continuity Management; and (14) Compliance. HOST further agrees that it shall at all times remain compliant with at least ISO 27001 relating to: (1) HOST Background and Expertise; and (2) HOST Operations and Risks. HOST represents and warrants familiarity with non-public, personal information (“NPI”) as such term is defined by the Gramm, Leach, Bliley Act (“GLBA”), and if HOST accesses, stores, process, or transmits NPI, HOST agrees to safeguard any NPI, in accordance with such act. HOST acknowledges that if HOST stores, processes, or transmits cardholder data as defined by PCI DSS or if the Services HOST provides can impact the security of CUSTOMER’s Cardholder Data Con-08310 sarf_229438 7 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F Environment (“CDE”), then HOST agrees that it is responsible, at its sole expense, for maintaining the security of cardholder data in its possession or that can be accessed through the Services provided under this Agreement, at a minimum, by maintaining continuous compliance with the then applicable version of PCI DSS and PA DSS. HOST represents and warrants that HOST will abide by, comply with and shall produce and maintain the Services and Deliverables in continual compliance with the Rules. If HOST Services include or HOST otherwise has access to CUSTOMER Secure Data then, HOST represents and warrants that the use of any Services or Deliverables by CUSTOMER or any CUSTOMER customer will not cause CUSTOMER or its customer to be non-compliant with any Rules or Laws, including but not limited to the PCI DSS, CISP, or SDP program. Further and notwithstanding HOST’s obligation to comply with the Rules, HOST shall, at its own cost and expense, represent and warrant that HOST and HOST’s systems used to store, process or transmit cardholder data, shall (i) have and maintain PCI DSS certification; and (ii) commit to a compliance validation process that will include validation of compliance with the current version of PCI DSS, as attested by a Qualified Security Assessor (QSA), as that term is defined by PCI. HOST shall provide CUSTOMER with the QSA’s Report on Compliance (“ROC”). Subsequently, HOST must re-validate its PCI DSS compliant status with a QSA annually and annually provide CUSTOMER with a copy of the new ROC for the Term of the Agreement. At the Effective Date of the Agreement, if HOST obtained a ROC from a QSA within the prior year under the current version of PCI DSS, HOST will provide that ROC and then annually re-validate its PCI DSS compliant status with a QSA and annually provide CUSTOMER with a copy of the new ROC for the Term of the Agreement. HOST will provide CUSTOMER evidence of HOST’s compliance with any warranty or representation contained herein, to the extent applicable, that such evidence shall include but not be limited to third-party audit reports and any reports on compliance or certificates that may be generated therefrom. Where applicable, HOST shall also, at its own cost and expense, maintain its applications certified for and in compliance with PA-DSS. If HOST Services include or HOST otherwise has access to CUSTOMER Secure Data then, at least as often as once per year and at HOST’s sole cost and expense, HOST will undertake a comprehensive test of its disaster recovery and business resumption plans, and if reasonably requested by CUSTOMER, HOST will engage an independent third-party to test, audit and verify HOST’s disaster recovery and business resumption plan at HOST’s expense. HOST will share all records, reports, internal or external audits, documentation and all other materials regarding such testing with CUSTOMER. Should HOST fail to provide adequate internal controls as described herein, or to present an action plan acceptable to CUSTOMER within the mutually agreed upon time frame, CUSTOMER shall be entitled, in its sole discretion and among other remedies, to terminate the Agreement with no liability to HOST. HOST shall not access CUSTOMER systems, networks, or CUSTOMER Data. If CUSTOMER provides prior written approval for HOST to access the CUSTOMER systems, networks, or CUSTOMER Data, then HOST shall not (1) access the same from outside of the United States, or (2) transmit, process, or store CUSTOMER Data outside the United States, unless CUSTOMER gives additional prior Con-08310 sarf_229438 8 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY OIK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F written approval. If CUSTOMER has provided additional prior written approval that HOST may provide Services from outside of the United States or store or process CUSTOMER Data outside of the United States, then HOST will provide the Services in a way that complies with CUSTOMER’S policies, standards, and plans (“CUSTOMER International Standards and Plans”), which will be provided when appropriate and will be updated from time to time by CUSTOMER, and assists CUSTOMER in achieving its business objectives. CUSTOMER will have final authority to promulgate CUSTOMER International Standards and Plans and to modify or grant waivers from such CUSTOMER International Standards and Plans. In such case, HOST will (i) comply with and enforce the CUSTOMER International Standards and Plans, (ii) modify the Services to conform to the CUSTOMER International Standards and Plans, and (iii) obtain CUSTOMER’s prior written approval for any deviations from CUSTOMER International Standards and Plans. 8. Security. 8.1. Minimum Security Standards. In addition to other compliance provisions of this Agreement, HOST shall implement and maintain appropriate and reasonable administrative, operational, physical, and technical safeguards to maintain the security, confidentiality and integrity of and prevent unauthorized access to or acquisition of HOST buildings, systems, networks, Services, or CUSTOMER Data. 8.1.1. Physical/Environmental. If HOST Services include or HOST otherwise has access to CUSTOMER Secure Data then, HOST shall ensure and, upon request of CUSTOMER, demonstrate: (i) That HOST facilities or processing systems that access CUSTOMER Secure Data are housed in secure areas that are protected by defined security perimeters, with financial industry standard security barriers and entry controls; (ii) That it has in place measures and means for the physical protection of employees, systems and equipment against damage from fire, flood, earthquake, explosion, civil unrest, utility failures and other forms of natural or man-made disaster; (iii) That all sensitive areas will be electronically controlled and monitored to ensure access only to authorized personnel with a need to know or access the data; (iv) That all physical access control, alarm, and CCTV systems shall be under the sole control of the HOST and that the records of all transactions, changes, deletions, etc. shall be auditable; (v) That all hosting sites, disaster recovery, third party or other locations utilized by the HOST that will store, transmit, or process CUSTOMER and its customer information are subject to audit/physical site review as provided in the Agreement, such sites will not reduce their security or change locations without prior written approval from CUSTOMER; and (vi) That it has documented security policies that are reviewed with all employees on a minimum of an annual basis. Con-08310 sarf_229438 9 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F 8.2. Encryption/Access Controls. If HOST Services include or HOST otherwise has access to CUSTOMER Secure Data then, HOST represents and warrants that HOST has and will maintain accepted contemporary industry standard encryption requirements for CUSTOMER Secure Data in transmission and storage are in place and satisfactory to CUSTOMER, including (as applicable) encryption on portable devices and media, encryption of information across trusted/untrusted networks, encryption of data at rest; and, strong authentication controls guarding access to information. HOST represents and warrants that if storing or transmitting: bank account or card numbers, identification numbers (SSN, driver’s license number, or other sensitive information etc.), or other data used to verify the identity of an individual (mother’s maiden name, date of birth, e¬ mail address etc.) is necessary, then such data will be encrypted using financial industry standard encryption levels and methods. 8.3. Vulnerability Management. If HOST Services include HOST otherwise or has access to CUSTOMER Secure Data then, at CUSTOMER’s written request, HOST shall promptly perform (or shall permit CUSTOMER or a third party selected by CUSTOMER to perform) a vulnerability threat assessment (“VTA”) test or such additional vulnerability or compromise assessment testing as may be reasonably required by CUSTOMER. The VTA may be performed, in CUSTOMER’s sole discretion, by either appointed members of CUSTOMER’s information integrity team or a security consultant selected and approved in writing by CUSTOMER. If HOST has access to Restricted data, then it shall perform quarterly vulnerability assessments of HOST’s systems used to perform the Services ("Assessments"). Such Assessments shall include an evaluation of HOST’s externally accessible computer systems from the perspective of an external attacker, with a focus on service discovery and service identification. This assessment shall include a logical assessment, penetration/intrusion testing and/or analysis services. Threats to HOST system availability and review of whether attackers could deny legitimate users access to information made available through HOST’s IT infrastructure may also be evaluated. Such quarterly Assessments shall be at HOST’s sole expense and shall be conducted by a third party nationally recognized for performing such Assessments (a “VTA HOST”), proposed by HOST and subject to CUSTOMER’s prior consent, which shall not be unreasonably withheld. CUSTOMER may also request that HOST have the VTA HOST conduct additional Assessments on an ad hoc basis, to provide reviews of HOST’s infrastructure, applications, networks, internal scans, external scans and code. Such ad hoc Assessments shall be conducted in a manner that does not compromise HOST’s reasonable security standards applicable to CUSTOMER, shall be conducted under HOST’s direction, and shall be at CUSTOMER's sole expense. CUSTOMER shall have the right to require HOST to use a different VTA HOST (other than the one proposed by HOST) to perform such additional ad hoc Assessments. The results of all Assessments described in this section shall be provided by HOST to CUSTOMER and shall include a comprehensive report of the Assessment findings, redacted to exclude only specific information that is confidential and proprietary to HOST’s other customers. HOST and CUSTOMER shall reach a mutual agreement regarding remediation of the findings within the Assessment results. Con-08310 sarf_229438 10 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F 8.4. Disaster Recovery Plan. If the Services are used in CUSTOMER core business or processing services, then HOST shall maintain a disaster recovery and contingency plan that meets or exceeds applicable industry practices, in accordance with Exhibit B. HOST shall deliver a comprehensive disaster recovery and business resumption plan, detailing HOST’s in-place procedures for daily back-up of data and systems, off-site storage of daily backup storage and records, record protection and contingency plans and other details regarding HOST’s disaster recovery and business resumption plan. If such plans do not meet such requirements or if a bank regulatory agency requires changes to such plans, HOST shall use commercially reasonable efforts to amend or enhance its disaster recovery and business resumption plan to meet the needs of CUSTOMER. 8.5. Security Breach. HOST shall immediately notify CUSTOMER of (a) any actual, attempted or reasonably suspected breach of HOST security, its services or systems; (b) any actual, attempted or reasonably suspected unauthorized access to or acquisition, use, loss, destruction, alteration, compromise or disclosure of any NPI, CUSTOMER Confidential Information, or CUSTOMER Data, or (c) any circumstance pursuant to which applicable law requires notification of such breach to be given to affected parties or other activity in response to such circumstance (each, a “Security Breach”). In the event of a Security Breach, HOST shall (i) promptly, but in no case more than 1 business days after HOST becomes aware of an actual breach or 10 business days of a suspected breach, provide to CUSTOMER a detailed description of the incident, the data accessed, the identity of individuals or entities involved, if available, and such other information as CUSTOMER may request concerning the Security Breach; (ii) provide CUSTOMER with the name and contact information for an employee of HOST who shall serve as HOST’s primary security contact and shall be available to assist CUSTOMER as a contact in resolving obligations associated with the Security Breach; (iii) assist CUSTOMER in investigating, remedying and taking any other action CUSTOMER deems necessary regarding any Security Breach and any dispute, inquiry or claim that concerns the Security Breach; (iv) facilitate interviews with HOST’s employees and third party service providers, such as computer security or forensic investigation firms assisting in responding to the Security Breach; (v) make available all relevant records, logs, files, report, and analysis regarding the Security Breach, as well as any other materials required to comply with applicable law, regulation, industry standards or as otherwise reasonably required by CUSTOMER; (vi) shall take prompt actions to ensure that such Security Breach or potential Security Breach will not recur; and (vii) cooperate with CUSTOMER and any law enforcement or regulatory official investigating such Security Breach. Notwithstanding the foregoing, to the extent not prohibited by applicable law, CUSTOMER shall make the final decision on notifying CUSTOMER customers, users, employees, service providers and/or the general public of such Security Breach or any other breach related to security which is not a Security Breach, and the implementation of the remediation plan. If a notification to a CUSTOMER or users is required under any applicable law, guidelines or best practice, then in addition to all other costs arising out of or in connection with such Security Breach, and without prejudice to all other rights and remedies available to CUSTOMER under this Agreement, at law or in equity, HOST shall reimburse CUSTOMER for all reasonable notification Con-08310 sarf_229438 11 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F related costs and other expenses incurred by CUSTOMER arising out of or in connection with any such Security Breach, including but not limited to, credit monitoring services. 9. GENERAL TERMS 9.1. Confidentiality Provisions; Nondisclosure of Confidential Information. By virtue of the Agreement, the parties may have access to information that is confidential to one another ("Confidential Information"). Confidential Information shall be limited to the Hosting System, the terms and pricing under this Agreement, CUSTOMER Data (subject to the exceptions identified below) and all information clearly identified as confidential in writing or should be reasonably known by the receiving party to be Confidential Information due to the nature of the information disclosed and the circumstances surrounding the disclosure. A party's Confidential Information shall not include information that: (a) is or becomes a part of the public domain through no act or omission of the other party; (b) was or becomes in the other party's lawful possession, without confidentiality obligation; or (c) is independently developed by the other party, without access or use of the Confidential Information. The receiving party will not disclose or use Confidential Information for any purpose other than as set forth in this Agreement. The requirements of this Section 9.1 will not be violated by CUSTOMER's disclosure of Confidential Information to Customer Affiliate Companies. In the event that either party is required for the purposes of legal or arbitration to disclose any Confidential Information, to the extent legally permitted, the party receiving such disclosure request will provide the other party with written notice as soon as possible of any such requirement, such that the other party may seek an appropriate protective order or other relief. 9.2 Data Breach Notification. HOST shall notify CUSTOMER in writing of any breach involving CUSTOMER Data within one (1) business day of HOST becoming aware of such breach. All reports of breaches of CUSTOMER Data shall be made in compliance with applicable laws, unless otherwise directed by law enforcement officials due to any criminal investigation that may arise from such breach. 9.3 Governing Law. The Agreement, and all matters arising out of or relating to the Agreement, shall be governed by the laws of the State of New Mexico, without giving effect to principles regarding conflicts of laws. 9.4 Notice. CUSTOMER agrees to make reasonable efforts to notify HOST of any changes to CUSTOMER's business address, business contact, and support contact within ten (10) days of any change thereto. All notices required or permitted hereunder shall be given in writing or as specifically set forth in the applicable section of this Agreement. To expedite order processing, CUSTOMER agrees that HOST may treat documents emailed or faxed by CUSTOMER to HOST, Con-08310 sarf_229438 12 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F including documents generated by online transactions, as original documents; nevertheless, either party may require the other to exchange original signed documents to evidence an order for Hosting System or for Services. If to CUSTOMER: Attn: General Counsel 8500 Governors Hill Dr. Symmes Township, OH 45249 If to HOST: RiskSense, Inc. 4200 Osuna Rd. NE Ste. 3-300 Albuquerque, NM 87109 Attn: Legal Department Facsimile: (505) 212-0084 Con-08310 sarf_229438 13 FOR LEGAL USE ONLY CJK DocuSign Envelope ID: BE5C1D8E-3077-44DC-8729-290D2091EB8F 9.5. Other Terms. In the event any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions of the Agreement will remain in full force. The waiver by either party of any default or breach of the Agreement shall not constitute a waiver of any other or subsequent default or breach. All rights and licenses granted to CUSTOMER in this Agreement shall apply to CUSTOMER’S subsidiaries provided CUSTOMER remains fully liable for the acts and any omissions of its subsidiaries under this Agreement. This Agreement constitutes the complete agreement between the parties and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements or representations, written or oral, concerning the subject matter of this Agreement. Neither party may assign this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other party, such consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed; any such assignment without prior consent shall be null and void. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either party may assign this Agreement to any entity who acquires (by merger, acquisition, or otherwise) all or substantially all of the business assets of such party’s applicable to the subject matter of this Agreement.
